page.title: 10Sonning Railway Cutting
page.content: 150 years ago on 31 August 1835 the {Great Western Railway}was created by act of Parliament to run from London to Bristol through Reading. Sonning Cutting is 1km long and is near Holme Park and the A4. Building Sonning Cutting was very tiring work.{Brunel}and his men and horses were shifting no less than 24,500 cubic yards of spoil a week , but the weather was terrible. Non- stop rain made the cutting very muddy and difficult to work in. One of the earliest{railway disasters}took place here on Christmas Eve 1841 when a goods train including two third _class carriages ran into a landslip in the cutting. Eight passengers were killed and 17 injured because the carriages were open-sided. The accident helped the movement to reform 3rd class travel.
